universum.studios.android.setting

Class SettingDialogPreferenceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.setting.SettingDialogPreferenceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SettingDialogPreference.OnClickListener

    public class SettingDialogPreferenceManager
extends Object
implements SettingDialogPreference.OnClickListener
    Manager that may be used to manage dialog prefernces presented on a single preference screen. This manager handles attaching of SettingDialogPreference.OnClickListener to all dialog preferences of PreferenceScreen passed to attachToPreferenceScreen(PreferenceScreen) and showing of preference dialogs for the associated dialog preferences whenever SettingDialogPreference.OnClickListener.onDialogPreferenceClick(SettingDialogPreference) is fired for a particular dialog preference. Dialog preferences manager also provides default handling of button click events occurred in those shown preference dialogs via handleOnPreferenceDialogButtonClick(Dialog, int) where this method delegates the click event to the associated dialog preference via SettingDialogPreference.handleOnDialogButtonClick(Dialog, int).

    Subclasses may inherit this manager and override any default behavior as needed.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Constructor Detail

      • SettingDialogPreferenceManager

        public SettingDialogPreferenceManager()
        Creates a new instance of SettingDialogPreferencesManager without either DialogController nor default DialogFactory.

        These should be specified via setDialogController(DialogController) and setDialogFactory(DialogFactory) otherwise the new manager will throw an exception if functionality related to dialogs is requested.

        See Also:
        SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Activity), SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Fragment)

      • SettingDialogPreferenceManager

        public SettingDialogPreferenceManager(@NonNull
                                      Activity activity)
        Creates a new instance of SettingDialogPreferencesManager for the given activity context.

        This constructor creates this manager with default instance of DialogController and default DialogXmlFactory with R.xml#ui_settings_dialogs file containing dialogs for all dialog preferences provided by the Settings library.

        Parameters:
        activity - The activity used to instantiate the default dialog controller along with default dialog factory.
        See Also:
        SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Fragment), DialogController.DialogController(Activity), getDialogController(), getDialogFactory()

      • SettingDialogPreferenceManager

        public SettingDialogPreferenceManager(@NonNull
                                      Fragment fragment)
        Creates a new instance of SettingDialogPreferencesManager for the given fragment context.

        This constructor creates this manager with default instance of DialogController and default DialogXmlFactory with R.xml#ui_settings_dialogs file containing dialogs for all dialog preferences provided by the Settings library.

        Parameters:
        fragment - The fragment used to instantiate the default dialog controller along with default dialog factory.
        See Also:
        SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Activity), DialogController.DialogController(Fragment), getDialogController(), getDialogFactory()

      • SettingDialogPreferenceManager

        public SettingDialogPreferenceManager(@NonNull
                                      FragmentManager fragmentManager)
        Creates a new instance of SettingDialogPreferencesManager for the given fragmentManager context.

        This constructor creates this manager with default instance of DialogController. The dialog factory need to be specified via setDialogFactory(DialogFactory)

        Parameters:
        fragmentManager - The fragment manager used to instantiate the default dialog controller.
        See Also:
        DialogController.DialogController(FragmentManager), getDialogController()

    • Method Detail

      • setDialogController

        public void setDialogController(@NonNull
                                universum.studios.android.dialog.manage.DialogController dialogController)
        Sets a dialog controller that should be used by this manager to show dialogs for the clicked dialog preferences.

        Note, that if the specified dialog controller does not have specified any dialog factory, the one specified for this manager will be set to it via DialogController.setFactory(DialogFactory).

        Parameters:
        dialogController - The desired dialog controller.
        See Also:
        getDialogController(), setDialogFactory(DialogFactory)

      • getDialogController

        @NonNull
public universum.studios.android.dialog.manage.DialogController getDialogController()
        Returns the dialog controller used by this manager.
        Returns:
        Default dialog controller or the one specified via setDialogController(DialogController).
        See Also:
        SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Activity), SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Fragment), SettingDialogPreferenceManager(FragmentManager)

      • setDialogFactory

        public void setDialogFactory(@Nullable
                             universum.studios.android.dialog.manage.DialogFactory dialogFactory)
        Sets a factory that provides dialog instances associated with the clicked dialog preferences. The given factory will be attached to the current dialog controller via DialogController.setFactory(DialogFactory).
        Parameters:
        dialogFactory - The desired dialog factory. May be null to clear the current one.
        See Also:
        getDialogFactory(), setDialogController(DialogController)

      • getDialogFactory

        @Nullable
public universum.studios.android.dialog.manage.DialogFactory getDialogFactory()
        Returns the current dialog factory set to this manager.
        Returns:
        Default dialog factory or the one specified via setDialogFactory(DialogFactory)
        See Also:
        setDialogFactory(DialogFactory), SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Activity), SettingDialogPreferenceManager(Fragment)

      • attachToPreferenceScreen

        public void attachToPreferenceScreen(@NonNull
                                     PreferenceScreen preferenceScreen)
        Attaches this manager to the given preferenceScreen.

        Dialog preferences manager will use the preference screen to look up for all instances of dialog preferences that are added to that preference screen. To all those dialog preferences is than this manager attached as SettingDialogPreference.OnClickListener so it may receive the preference click callback and show dialog for that particular preference. The context that is using this manager should dispatch Dialog.OnDialogListener#onDialogButtonClick(Dialog, int) callback to this manager via handleOnPreferenceDialogButtonClick(Dialog, int).

        When this manager is no more needed it should be detached from the attached preference screen via detachFromPreferenceScreen(PreferenceScreen).

        Parameters:
        preferenceScreen - The preference screen to attach to.

      • onAttachedToPreference

        protected void onAttachedToPreference(@NonNull
                                      SettingDialogPreference dialogPreference)
        Called when this manager has been successfully attached to the given dialogPreference.
        Parameters:
        dialogPreference - The dialog preference to which has been this manager just attached.
        See Also:
        attachToPreferenceScreen(PreferenceScreen)

      • findDialogPreference

        @Nullable
public SettingDialogPreference findDialogPreference(int dialogId)
        Searches for the dialog preference associated with the specified dialogId.

        Note, that the manager should be attached to preference screen via attachToPreferenceScreen(PreferenceScreen) otherwise this method will always return null.

        Parameters:
        dialogId - Id of the dialog associated with the desired preference to find.
        Returns:
        Found dialog preference or null if this manager is not attached to preference screen at this time or there is no dialog preference with such dialog id associated.

      • detachFromPreferenceScreen

        public void detachFromPreferenceScreen(@NonNull
                                       PreferenceScreen preferenceScreen)
        Detaches this manager from the given preferenceScreen if previously attached via attachToPreferenceScreen(PreferenceScreen).
        Parameters:
        preferenceScreen - The preference screen from which to detach this manager.

      • onDetachedFromPreference

        protected void onDetachedFromPreference(@NonNull
                                        SettingDialogPreference dialogPreference)
        Called when this manager has been successfully detached from the given dialogPreference.
        Parameters:
        dialogPreference - The dialog preference from which has been this manager just detached.
        See Also:
        detachFromPreferenceScreen(PreferenceScreen)

      • onDialogPreferenceClick

        public boolean onDialogPreferenceClick(@NonNull
                                       SettingDialogPreference dialogPreference)
        This implementation check whether this manager has dialog factory attached and also if that factory provides dialog instance with dialog id associated with the clicked dialogPreference. If so, onShowPreferenceDialog(DialogController, SettingDialogPreference) is called to show the preference dialog.
        Specified by:
        onDialogPreferenceClick in interface SettingDialogPreference.OnClickListener
        Parameters:
        dialogPreference - The clicked dialog preference.
        Returns:
        True if the click event has been handled, false otherwise.

      • onShowPreferenceDialog

        protected boolean onShowPreferenceDialog(@NonNull
                                         universum.studios.android.dialog.manage.DialogController dialogController,
                                         @NonNull
                                         SettingDialogPreference preference)
        Called from onDialogPreferenceClick(SettingDialogPreference) to show a dialog for the clicked preference.
        Parameters:
        dialogController - Current dialog controller of this manager that may be used to show the dialog associated with the clicked preference..
        preference - The preference that has been clicked.
        Returns:
        True if the preference dialog has been successfully shown, false otherwise.

      • handleOnPreferenceDialogButtonClick

        public boolean handleOnPreferenceDialogButtonClick(@NonNull
                                                   universum.studios.android.dialog.Dialog dialog,
                                                   int button)
        Handles button click occurred in the given preference dialog.
        Parameters:
        dialog - The preference dialog where the button has been clicked.
        button - The clicked dialog button.
        Returns:
        True if this manager is attached to preference screen and the button click has been successfully handled by the associated dialog preference, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        SettingDialogPreference.handleOnDialogButtonClick(Dialog, int)
